    • Method Detail

      • catena

        public byte[] catena(byte[] pwd,
                     byte[] salt,
                     byte[] publicInput,
                     byte[] gamma,
                     int m)
        Main function of catena to hash a password
        Parameters:
        pwd - Password to be hashed
        salt - Salt of arbitrary length
        publicInput - User choosen public input
        gamma - Input for graph size
        m - User desired output length of hash
        Returns:
        xTrun Hash of pwd

      • flapPub

        public byte[] flapPub(int g,

                      byte[] gamma)

      • testHInit

        public byte[] testHInit(byte[] x)
        No clue how to test private functions so this wrapper exists
        Parameters:
        x - Initial value to instantiate v-2 and v-1
        Returns:
        v-2 and v-1 combined in one array

      • testCompTweak

        public byte[] testCompTweak(String vId,
                            int mode,
                            int lambda,
                            int outLen,
                            int sLen,
                            byte[] aData)
        public interface for testing tweak computation
        Parameters:
        vId - String, VersionID
        mode - Integer, Mode of Catena
        lambda - Integer, The depth of the graph structure.
        outLen - Integer, Output length.
        sLen - Integer, Salt length.
        aData - byte[], Associated data of the user and/or the host.
        Returns:
        tweak byte[], The calculatetd tweak.

      • init

        public void init(HashInterface h,
                 HashInterface hPrime,
                 GammaInterface gamma,
                 GraphInterface f,
                 IdxInterface idx,
                 PhiInterface phi,
                 int gLow,
                 int gHigh,
                 int lambda,
                 String vID)
        Initializes Catena initializrs all needed variables and functions with default values
        Parameters:
        h - main hash function
        hPrime - reduced hash function
        gamma - gamma function (e.g. SaltMix)
        f - graph
        idx - index function for graph
        phi - phi function
        gLow - minimum Garlic
        gHigh - maximum Garlic
        lambda - depth of graphs
        vID - version ID
